WRITING.TITLE: Dating an Addict
WRITING.TEXT: Background information: We have been together off and on for about a year and a half now. We broke up in September of 2015, but when we started talking about two months ago (March of 2016), we were originally going to keep it as just friends, however it now seems like we are almost back together. When we first met, in October of 2015, people warned me about his drug habit and tendency to lash out. I chose to ignore the warnings, because i try my best not to judge people based on rumors. When our relationship first started out, i would see him stoned occasionally, but that was it. As months progressed, i realized he had a ketamine addiction that was just getting worse and worse. As of now, he's stopped ketamine, but has picked up prescription pills to cope. My Dilemma: I don't know what to do. We can't go out because he is noticeably high, he doesn't remember the time we spend together, and the pills turn him into an ass. He called a mutual friend a few nights ago, and spilled my secrets and thoughts to him, which was very embarrassing for me. I know he wants to stop, but he always runs to drugs when things go wrong. i can't bring him around my parents because he would have to get fucked up to have a meal with them. I feel like i will never be emotionally satisfied, but at the same time, i don't want to leave. When he's sober, things are fantastic, and we can have meaningful conversations. I just feel like I'm wanting something that is never going to be anything. Should i just move on? If it hasn't worked for a year and a half should i just give up? Im tired of waiting for it to get better. But when things are great, they are so great. I have so many great memories of us laughing, and just enjoying one another. But, when things aren't great, they really do suck. I guess I'm just really confused and unsure what to do. Dating an addict is hard. Its hard to watch them run to their substance, and its hard watching them fall. This is just a mindless rant, and also my first reddit post. Please don't be too mad at me if my format isn't that of an experienced reddit user. I just needed to get this off my chest.
drinking to cope is a risky path to travel, be safe man.
thank you for the tip!
yeah, i have a small circle of friends who say they have "drug habits", I've seen them do some pretty shady things for a few extra bucks. thank you.

WRITING.TITLE: Me [18 F] with a very needy Boyfriend [18 M]
WRITING.TEXT: Last night, my boyfriend and I were hanging out at his house. I was originally at a friends house, who i rarely hang out with, because I'm usually with him. But due to repeated texts of "come over now" "please don't leave me" "lets hang out now", I left my friend's house early. I arrive at his house, and he's throwing himself a pity party. He was saying how, "Life is awful" "I should just kill myself", I slowly began to feel more and more uncomfortable. I am unsure of how to respond to these remarks, and it was like he was fishing for my affection? He then began to try and "get me in the mood", and got even more moody when I didn't want to have sex. He then needed his inhaler, and asked me to look on the desk for him. When I couldn't find it in 3 seconds, he started going on about "I guess I just won't use my inhaler anymore"; after digging around in a drawer, I found it, then he said, "This is why I *NEED* you. I'm too dumb to do these types of things on my own." He needs me to find an inhaler? He needs me to do menial tasks that a child could do? Then, we got on the topic of our 2 year anniversary coming up, he said he wanted to get me a ring that has "always" engraved on it. That was just about it for me, I said my mom needed help in the kitchen and left. Always and needing me? I feel trapped, and am unsure what to do. Is he acting childish and needy or am I afraid to be serious? Am i afraid for the right reasons? Is he too childish and too needy? Any comments helping me, or even an anecdotal advice to help me with this is welcomed and greatly appreciated. tl;dr: My boyfriend is becoming very needy
It seems like you aren't emotionally satisfied, you can either bring it up to her to see what she says or see if she starts putting in effort, or you could break it off.. sorry man..
as i get deeper and deeper into this situation, more red flags pop up. thank you.
Thank you.
Thats what i worry about, the "I'll kill myself" to keep me here. By the way, i love the way you worded that, don't let anyone force your hand. thank you!
It is slowly becoming more and more tiresome, we started our relationship when we were more immature, i just think I'm growing apart. Thank you so much!
Feeling like his nursemaid is what it is really feeling like. thank you!

its hard to forget someone who was so important to you and who you experienced so much with. It is a cliche, but time will heal this, and you will meet someone new. It might be hard, but maybe not even having contact as friends might help you move on. Good luck.
i will inform them of this. thank you very much!
since i have made this post, my friends and i did trip. My friend taking the ssri, they are taking lexapro, did trip.

DONT CUT THE HAIR PLEASE! DISREGARD ALL THE COMMENTS SAYING TO DO SO! the color of your hair pulls out the bright color in your eyes! You have no reason to be insecure! You're quiet attractive my dude!!
You're cute! You have no reason to stress !
This is a great idea. Thank you.
Look for local artists on Instagram. If you can't find something similar, maybe you can find something better! Sorry bout the broken glass though, that always sucks

I've smoked with my uncle, and it was one of the most memorable sessions. He gave me an old pipe of his and tried teaching me how to roll, we also talked about his childhood and old memories and such. Weed just brings people together.

WRITING.TITLE: The future
WRITING.TEXT: all I do is worry about the future. I don't know what college I want to attend yet, or what I want to major in. I feel like my life has no direction and I don't know what I want to do. It's just so stressful and I don't know how to go about figuring it out. I'm really afraid I won't figure it out.
I tried the paper clip and that was effective !

WRITING.TITLE: Four Years of Hard Work
WRITING.TEXT: I've been in high school for the passed four years and have been told, if I worked hard, I could get into a good college. I have worked hard. I have a 3.8 gpa, not Harvard worthy, but something to be proud of. These passed four years I've studied for every class, never had a missing assignment, and busted my ass in an academic sense. When it came time for college applications, I thought I had finally worked hard enough and I would be moving away from home next year. I was excited. Except. All the colleges I've applied to have rejected me. I don't know what to do. Only my local state school has accepted me and it's been such a slap in the face to know my hard work hasn't gotten me anywhere. I could've made straight Cs and yielded these same results. Nights of studying for AP tests, creating flashcards, and doing my best has amounted to absolutely nothing. It's been a week since the school I thought I was going to go to rejected me. Now at school, I don't do the work. I don't care. Why should I care? Why should I continue to work hard when there is no pay out? All my hard work was for nothing and all I can do now is sign up for community college. Tldr; I feel I worked hard these passed four years, only to get denied from every single college I applied to. Thank you for reading.
Amen

This really did help. I've talked it over with my parents and we decided on a community college to save money and explore other job options. I know it'll work out, it just is kinda hard I have to take a different rout to get there. Thank you thank you thank you
You are very kind. Thank you.
I'd pay him to punch me
Honestly go for it.

WRITING.TITLE: How specific are *your* attractions ?
WRITING.TEXT: My basis for finding someone attractive is if they have long beautiful hair, either gender. All of my partners have had it and in my friend group it is jokes about how specific it is. If someone has bad hair, it's really hard for me to consider them physically attractive. I just wanted to know if anyone else had make or break physical characteristics for considering someone attractive.

WRITING.TITLE: The consequence of getting lazy
WRITING.TEXT: I used to be in the best physical shape. I would work out 2 hours in the morning then another 3 in the afternoon. I used to be able to run a mile and not feel winded. I stopped this routine about 2 years ago and since then have lost 20 pounds. I went back to the gym today and I could only last 40 minutes without feeling nauseous, tired, and needing to leave. It's frustrating to know I've let myself fall this deep. I need to be strict with myself again. I need to monitor my eating habits and I need to start pushing myself again. It's hard to walk out knowing I used to be there for hours and now I can only stand 40 minutes of a fairly easy work out. I guess this will be my drive to get back in shape.

WRITING.TITLE: Going Straight to the Work Force
WRITING.TEXT: I have never enjoyed school. Whether it was getting bullied throughout elementary school and the school refusing to recognize it, the general horrors of middle school, or the truly saddening experience of high school... I have hated it all. I busted my ass for four years to get a 3.8 but to have no college accept me. I'm so embarrassed that I'm going to a city college while all my friends got into their dream school. I'm starting to believe school might not be for me. I really don't want to go through the experience of jumping through hoops and busting my ass for a degree that might not even secure a job. Not to mention the debt it'll land me in. I'm considering, against my parents wishes (they are doctors), going straight into the work force. I'm really considering selling real estate or maybe becoming a repairman of sorts. School has only isolated me and disappointed me. I don't want to do it again. I've had enough. If anyone has any advice it'd be appreciated.

I'd prefer not to name them because they might give out where I live. But I applied to 8. They weren't prestigious schools like Harvard or anything. All my teachers told me i could get into the schools with my gpa but it didnt happen.
Thank you
Yes, I am white. And I come from an affluent background, I couldn't get any scholarships either.
I had just an average score. A 1000 something or other.
This is what I needed to hear, thank you

Sigh. I'm graduating high school and I smoke too. Every time one of my friends got caught with any drugs, I was ALWAYS the scapegoat. I'm not exaggerating. I'm going to tell you the lesson I wish I had learned in my junior year. People who you get fucked up with are not your friends. When push comes to shove and it's time to take responsibility, they will do whatever they have to to get in the least amount of trouble. It's not fair and it hurts a lot. Learn quickly who is using you for drugs and who is genuinely a friend.
It's just frustrating because kids with a 3.5, who aren't white, got into my dream school.
Keep growing! Keep growing! Keep growing!
I know I know, and it's not fair. But I can't do anything about it except deal with the repercussions the system has given me.
I smoke and I have no friends. Fuck
I appreciate this. Thank you friend.
